{"step_by_step_thinking": "The newborn's symptoms of high-pitched crying, poor feeding, rhinorrhea, low-grade fever, hyperreflexia, tremors, and an excessive startle response are suggestive of neonatal withdrawal syndrome. This condition is most commonly associated with maternal use of substances that lead to physical dependence, and withdrawal symptoms can occur in the neonate after birth when the substance is no longer available. The substances most commonly associated with neonatal withdrawal are opioids, which are mu receptor agonists. Therefore, the mother likely used a mu receptor agonist.", "answer_choice": "A"}
